Articles.Content:
True.

Will the next user write No?

True, no?

The user below me has an avatar that is a gif jellyfish holding a weapon and jiggling about like a madman.

Hell yeah!

The user below me think that my avatar is Wibbly-Wobbly Timey-Wimey.

Truetruetruetrue, my friend.

The user below my (BETTER) understands the significance of the terms "Allons-y!", "Geronimo!", and "Bow ties are cool."

Fezzes are cool aswell

The user below me never worn a fez before

What the heck is a fez?

The user below me also doesn't know what a fez is

False.

The user below me is astounded by the sheer fact that people don't understand Dr Who references .

True.

The user below wants the user below the user below him to watch Doctor Who.

heh... I don't realy care actualy... False

The user below me is a part of another fandom other that KSP.

well true if you count doctor who

the user below me is also part of another fandom besides doctor who and KSP

False.

The user below me has no idea who I am.

false, you are the latest person to post on all 5 of the most recent forum games at around the same time...

the user below me doubts how true the above statement is..

True, mostly because that's literally impossible (he did it all within the same microsecond, eh? Nah.)

The user below thinks I'm a little overly pedantic here.

Nope, knowledge is power, you never had enough!

The user below me know the band called Muse.

False. You hipster.

The user below me will find a funny way to come up with an answer that is completely unexpected to the "The user below me" sentence they are currently reading at this moment.

True, Muse is a well known rock band, one which I am neutral to.

The user below me wonders: What light through yonder window breaks?

False.

The user below me thinks the Mun is made of Kethane.

False, it is made from Kerbothalumutinane Thiocarboxyhydrojebobilllium Bultoniate (KeTAlMC3O3HJeBBoBl2)*.

*Based on small samples from meteor impact craters. This is the major element, making up 46% of Mun's surface.

The user below me is astounded by this fact.

Edited March 20, 2014 by Shna_na

Kinda true... Also, I notice you stuck Jeb and Bob into the formula.

The user below me will be checking or has already checked what I just said.

Yep. This is true.

The user below knows what and how and Infinite Improbability Drive is and works.

False. I'd like to know though.

On a side note:

I notice you stuck Jeb and Bob into the formula.

Correct, Bill is also in there (the 'jebobillium' part can be broken down into Jeb-Bob-Bill-ium).

The user below me is biomagnetic.

Improbability Drive? That one from the Heart of Fold ship? The one which was stolen by Zaphod Beeblebrox? I think I know it, but, back on-topic:

I don't think so.....

The user below me like bees

false, i'm neutral towards them.

The person below me looked at my avatar before writing a response to this statement.

This is true. If that is your avatar, I did indeed move my eyes over the spot before I began typing.

The user below knows how to use Blender3D.

Just a bit, I can do some "veeeeery basic stuff"

The user below me knows what happened on the fields of Trenzalore.
